page.title: 04Riding of the Marches, Annan
page.content: Every year the people of Annan celebrate the Riding of the Marches on the first Saturday in July. At 8 am a crowd of riders leave the Town Hall and ride round the marches {(ancient boundaries)}checking that everything is in order.When they come back into town a{parade}starts down the High Street,with{the Queen of the {Border,and children in fancy dress,and {decorated lorries. In the afternoon there is a{funfair and{sports}for children, and a {Majorettes' marching and dancing competition. The day finishes with a massed {pipe_band parade}in the High Street, but people go on celebrating late into the night.
